channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Pakistan and Afghanistan agree to maintain a ceasefire -- for now. Here's what to know
item.description: Relations between the two neighbors hit a low point this month, with fighting killing people on both sides of the border. At issue is a rise in militancy in Pakistan since the Taliban took over Afghanistan.
item.content:encoded:
Relations between the two neighbors hit a low point this month, with fighting killing people on both sides of the border. At issue is a rise in militancy in Pakistan since the Taliban took over Afghanistan.

(Image credit: AFP)
item.dc:creator: Betsy Joles

item.title: Federal judges order administration to pay SNAP benefits but what's next remains unclear
item.description: Two federal judges ordered the Trump administration to use emergency funding to provide SNAP benefits. But it's unclear how much, or when, those funds would be provided before the funding runs dry.
item.content:encoded:
Two federal judges ordered the Trump administration to use emergency funding to provide SNAP benefits. But it's unclear how much, or when, those funds would be provided before the funding runs dry.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: What does '67' mean? Dictionary.com's 2025 word of the year has no definition
item.description: "67," pronounced "six seven," spread from a rap song, through sports and social media, to classrooms and homes across the U.S. But even the artist who coined it struggles to define it.
item.content:encoded:
"67," pronounced "six seven," spread from a rap song, through sports and social media, to classrooms and homes across the U.S. But even the artist who coined it struggles to define it.

(Image credit: Chris Delmas)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Photos: Food banks scramble to get ready as SNAP funding deadline looms
item.description: Some 42 million people in the U.S. who rely on SNAP benefits could soon join the already long lines at the nation's food banks and pantries that are also serving struggling federal workers.
item.content:encoded:
Some 42 million people in the U.S. who rely on SNAP benefits could soon join the already long lines at the nation's food banks and pantries that are also serving struggling federal workers.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Families say cost of housing means they'll have fewer or no children
item.description: Western states have some of America's lowest fertility rates. The rapidly rising cost of housing is playing a role.
item.content:encoded:
Western states have some of America's lowest fertility rates. The rapidly rising cost of housing is playing a role.

(Image credit: Hanna Merzbach)
item.dc:creator: Hanna Merzbach

item.title: It's not for Halloween — it's Comic Con, where Black and Caribbean cosplayers find community
item.description: Black and Caribbean cosplayers are redefining what community looks like at New York Comic Con.
item.content:encoded:
Black and Caribbean cosplayers are redefining what community looks like at New York Comic Con.

(Image credit: Isaac Campbell for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Nikki Birch

item.title: A judge to weigh in on SNAP benefits. And, Trump wants to resume nuclear testing
item.description: A federal judge is set to decide whether the Trump administration will have to find funds to keep SNAP benefits flowing. And, President Trump says the U.S. should resume nuclear weapons testing.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge is set to decide whether the Trump administration will have to find funds to keep SNAP benefits flowing. And, President Trump says the U.S. should resume nuclear weapons testing.

(Image credit: Miguel J. Rodriguez Carrillo)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: The Trump administration move to study aluminum in vaccines worries scientists
item.description: Aluminum has been added to certain vaccines for decades to boost their effect on the immune system, and has been shown to be safe. But, the Trump administration may be considering removing it.
item.content:encoded:
Aluminum has been added to certain vaccines for decades to boost their effect on the immune system, and has been shown to be safe. But, the Trump administration may be considering removing it.

(Image credit: Sebastian Kahnert/picture alliance)
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein

item.title: 5 key takeaways from Trump's week in Asia
item.description: President Trump is back in Washington after spending a week in Asia. He attended the ASEAN summit in Kuala Lumpur, addressed U.S. troops in Japan and met with China's President Xi Jinping in South Korea.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump is back in Washington after spending a week in Asia. He attended the ASEAN summit in Kuala Lumpur, addressed U.S. troops in Japan and met with China's President Xi Jinping in South Korea.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: What has 11 questions and makes you feel smart? Our news quiz!
item.description: From monsters to politics and (maybe) everything in between, it's the weekly news quiz.
item.content:encoded: From monsters to politics and (maybe) everything in between, it's the weekly news quiz.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris
